title: 6 Simple Steps to Get an Embed Code from YouTube

steps.title: Go to https://youtube.com in a browser on your computer.
steps.content: Go to https://youtube.com in a browser on your computer. You can get the embed code from a video or playlist on YouTube using any web browser. For easier navigation, log into your YouTube account .

steps.title: Navigate to the video or playlist you want to embed.
steps.content: Navigate to the video or playlist you want to embed. You can browse through recommendations or search for a specific video by typing in the search bar at the top of the page. If you're sharing a playlist, click Playlists in the left panel to find your saved playlists . Then, click View full playlist . Videos and Playlists must be set to Public or Unlisted to share.

steps.title: Click Share.
steps.content: Click Share . This is at the bottom of the video, next to the right-facing arrow. On Playlists, you'll see this to the right of the playlist title.

steps.title: Click Embed.
steps.content: Click Embed . This "<>" icon is usually first in the menu. A code will appear. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Edit your embedded video options.
steps.content: Edit your embedded video options. Before you embed the video, you can change the options, such as starting time, player control visibility, and privacy-enhanced mode. To change the start time of a video, click Start at and enter a starting timestamp. To enable player controls (video playback and volume), check the box for Show player controls . To turn on privacy-enhanced mode, check the box for Enable privacy-enhanced mode . This prevents YouTube from storing visitor information unless they play the video.

steps.title: Click Copy.
steps.content: Click Copy . This is at the bottom-right corner of the embed window. The embed code will be saved to your device's clipboard. You can now paste the code in your HTML code or website .
